repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
#### vim-patch:8.1.0342: crash when a callback deletes a window that is being used

Problem:    Crash when a callback deletes a window that is being used.
Solution:   Do not unload a buffer that is being displayed while redrawing the
            screen. Also avoid invoking callbacks while redrawing.
            (closes vim/vim#2107)
https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/94f01956a583223dafe24135489d0ab1100ab0ad

Omit parse_queued_messages(): N/A


#### vim-patch:8.1.0425: ml_get error and crash with appendbufline()

Problem:    ml_get error and crash with appendbufline(). (Masashi Iizuka)
Solution:   Set per-window buffer info. (Hirohito Higashi, closes vim/vim#3455)
https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/9cea87c5775948a35098f3602746c20ecf95dbcd

comment_data.body: @zeertzjq I was referring to this test, not the terminal (mouse) lua tests.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -93,6 +93,33 @@ func Test_appendbufline()
   exe "bwipe! " . b
 endfunc
 
+func Test_appendbufline_no_E315()

comment_data.body: This test passes both with and without the code change.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -93,6 +93,33 @@ func Test_appendbufline()
   exe "bwipe! " . b
 endfunc
 
+func Test_appendbufline_no_E315()

comment_data.body: If the test likely won't fail with later patches, then we can port the test if we can't port the `*.c` changes.

comment_regular_data.body: Don't we want this, even if it doesn't exactly close https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/10386 ?
The first patch was included in another PR #20662.

Test failure still happens:
```
FAILED   test/functional/terminal/mouse_spec.lua @ 526: :terminal mouse when the terminal has focus with a split window and other buffer handles terminal size when switching buffers
test/functional/terminal/mouse_spec.lua:539: Row 1 did not match.
Expected:
  |*rows: 5, cols: 25        │rows: 5, cols: 25       |
  |*rows: 5, cols: 24        │rows: 5, cols: 24       |
  |*mouse enabled            │mouse enabled           |
  |*rows: 5, cols: 25        │rows: 5, cols: 25       |
  |*^                         │                        |
  |==========                ==========              |
  |:bn                                               |
Actual:
  |*^line21                   │rows: 5, cols: 25       |
  |*line22                   │rows: 5, cols: 24       |
  |*line23                   │mouse enabled           |
  |*line24                   │rows: 5, cols: 25       |
  |*line25                   │                        |
  |==========                ==========              |
  |:bn                                               |

To print the expect() call that would assert the current screen state, use
screen:snapshot_util(). In case of non-deterministic failures, use
screen:redraw_debug() to show all intermediate screen states.

Snapshot:
screen:expect([[
  ^line21                   │rows: 5, cols: 25       |
  line22                   │rows: 5, cols: 24       |
  line23                   │mouse enabled           |
  line24                   │rows: 5, cols: 25       |
  line25                   │                        |
  ==========                ==========              |
  :bn                                               |
]])

stack traceback:
	test/functional/ui/screen.lua:857: in function '_wait'
	test/functional/ui/screen.lua:520: in function 'expect'
	test/functional/terminal/mouse_spec.lua:539: in function <test/functional/terminal/mouse_spec.lua:526>
```

title: vim-patch:8.1.{0342,0425}: can_unload_buffer()
